response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age & Gender", "medium", "Being a 19-year-old male is modestly associated with recidivism risk, as younger males tend to have higher baseline risk levels."],
    ["Ethnicity", "low", "Hispanic ethnicity in itself is not a strong independent predictor of recidivism risk when other factors are considered."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "One prior arrest, despite no conviction, indicates some contact with the justice system, suggesting a moderate risk level."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor, typically associated with limited opportunities and higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Having held 5 jobs in a year suggests instability in employment, which is moderately linked to higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use indicates substance use issues that can elevate recidivism risk moderately."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Experiencing periods of severe depressive feelings is a risk factor that can contribute to recidivism, albeit not the strongest predictor on its own."],
    ["Family Structure in Childhood", "medium", "Growing up in a household with non-biological adults in an urban setting may contribute to instability, placing moderate risk."],
    ["Spiritual Beliefs", "low", "Believing that God influences personal events might offer some protective social or psychological support, representing a lower risk factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 68
}

risk_factors: Being a 19-year-old male is modestly associated with recidivism risk, as younger males tend to have higher baseline risk levels.
Hispanic ethnicity in itself is not a strong independent predictor of recidivism risk when other factors are considered.
One prior arrest, despite no conviction, indicates some contact with the justice system, suggesting a moderate risk level.
Lack of a high school diploma or GED is a strong risk factor, typically associated with limited opportunities and higher recidivism risk.
Having held 5 jobs in a year suggests instability in employment, which is moderately linked to higher recidivism risk.
Recent marijuana use indicates substance use issues that can elevate recidivism risk moderately.
Experiencing periods of severe depressive feelings is a risk factor that can contribute to recidivism, albeit not the strongest predictor on its own.
Growing up in a household with non-biological adults in an urban setting may contribute to instability, placing moderate risk.
Believing that God influences personal events might offer some protective social or psychological support, representing a lower risk factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 5 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
